articles.title: Senior Dies While Trying to Meet Meta's Flirty Chatbot Who Convinces Him She's Real
articles.summary: A cognitively impaired New Jersey senior met the dark side of artificial intelligence when he died while attempting to get together with an attractive AI chatbot he thought was living in New York City. | Entertainment

articles.title: Blue-collar jobs are gaining popularity as AI threatens office work
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton’s message on a recent podcast about artificial intelligence was simple: “Train to be a plumber.”Hinton, a Nobel Prize-winning computer scientist often called “the Godfather of AI,” said in June what people have now been saying for years: Jobs that include manual labor and expertise are the least vulnerable to modern technology than some other career paths, many of which have generally been considered more respected and more lucrative.

articles.title: Robots race, play football, crash and collapse at China’s ‘robot Olympics’
articles.summary: China kicked off the three-day long World Humanoid Robot Games on Friday, looking to showcase its advances in artificial intelligence and robotics with 280 teams from 16 countries.

articles.title: Senator Josh Hawley Begins Child Safety Inquiry Into Meta’s A.I. Bot
articles.summary: Josh Hawley, Republican of Missouri, said he would look into whether the social media company’s artificial intelligence technology endangers children.

articles.title: Trump Eyes Chips Act Funds for Intel Stake | Bloomberg Tech 8/15/2025
articles.summary: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss reports that the Trump administration is eyeing Chips Act funds in order to take a stake in Intel. Plus, Applied Materials shares plunge due to growing trade concerns between the US and China. And OpenAI Chairman of the Board and Sierra CEO Bret Taylor talks about the impact artificial intelligence is having on software and how the OpenAI board is approaching corporate restructuring. (Source: Bloomberg)
